comment: Dr. Sergio was exemplary. Since this was an online course, my biggest fear was being able to get a hold of him. He exceeded all expectations. When ever I had a question about an assignment, he would answer within a day or so. He is also more than willing to work with you as long as you give a decent amount of effort in the class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I took Professor Figueiredo for a maymester and really enjoyed his class. I won't lie, the class is a lot of work, but the content is engaging and really makes you think. I would love to take a class he teaches again
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Caring

comment: He gave us plenty of resources to read for our assignments and didn't expect too much from us because he cared more about our learning than grading. For the May semester, we completed 5 discussions and 3 major assignments. As long as you do your best, read the assigned readings, and show that you put in effort, this class should be easy.

I took Sergio for his rhetorical theory course. He never actually taught the class, the discussions were all student centered and he never clarified what was right or wrong yet expected us to know what he thought was right. He failed me for the course when I completed a 20 page essay and my last page was not a full page. Literally gave me a zero.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: He really offended me, was very political. I was just trying to state my opinion and it felt like he attacked me for it. The most annoying part of his class was the assignment guidelines were so vague and it seemed like he was more concerned with impressing you with his writing abilities in the description rather then making it clear and helpful.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: You can participate in discussion w/o reading. Don't be afraid to disagree with him. You want to be sure he knows your name, so talk to him before/after class and snag a seat up front. Stop in during his office hours (he is into mentoring) if you have a question about a paper. Lastly, you get to redo 1 paper-so take advantage of that. A good guy.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: This course gave me a run for my money, but I am so glad that I stuck it out. This class is challenging, but it truly makes you think. The class is pretty much all discussion so participation is key. Prepare to really think critically. I highly recommend this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: He's a very nice guy and makes rhetoric easy to understand and AT TIMES enjoyable! He loves open debate and is totally approachable. You get to re-do one paper for a better grade, so choose carefully. Writing assignments were for participation credit and not actual "grades."

Did not learn anything from his writing class. He did not teach, so it was like a free class for him and the students. If you actually want to learn something, take someone else who knows how to teach effectively. Is an easy A if you don't care about class or writing. Not my favorite professor or class.

Dr. F is awesome! Takes feedback from students seriously throughout the semester. Gives insightful feedback on student work. Assignments are fun and creative, really gets you to think about yourself for past, present, and future. Provides so many helpful resources. I loved this class and would take it again. He's so nice too- great prof!

I won't lie- Rhetorical Theory is difficult. However, Sergio is incredibly passionate about the subject and is eager to teach. Sometimes he gets flustered, but it's because he wants his students to be engaged in the material. Very nice guy and very helpful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Serg is one of those professors you'll take once and then consistently look for as your build your class schedule for the rest of college. He's enthusiastic, brilliant, and treats his students with respect. I was not excited about this class and he completely changed my mind. If you have the opportunity, take a course with Serg!

Obviously a rhetorical theory class is going to have difficult material, but that does not reflect upon Sergio at all. He is one of the most genuine professors at Kennesaw and really cares for his students. He provides great feedback on essays and always takes time in class to see how the students are progressing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Needs more clear grading criteria. Needs to be less coded on the topics of rhetoric, especially to the students who already understand its universal implications. Sometimes lectures aren't that enlightening, and to me, that's a big deal. He is super chill though, super easy to talk to, and he lets you revise papers for better grades. Easy A or B.

Dr. F likes to make classes as difficult as possible. Always says that he needs to add more work next time he teaches the class. Dr. F. is one of those profs that expect improvement so your grades start low and go up. I wish I took Nina Morgan and she has a horrid reputation so consider that. Dr. F. is cool though, I will give him that. I like him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: He was a great professor for this course! Sometimes, the material was a little heavy and philosophical, but he presented it in a way that made sense and he understood that not every student was as into it as he was. The assignments were fun and I learned a lot more than I thought I would. He's a pretty lenient grader too.
He was a great teacher and was very helpful but I got A's on all my papers and did all but one home work assignment and got a B...

The teacher is very patient and clear. He always asks students to come up to him if you have questions or even to look at your assignments! He is super nice and tolerant of a lot of stuff and he's super chill! I would definetly recommend this teacher.

Dr. Figueiredo is patient, approachable, knowledgeable, and appears to genuinely care that his students achieve their educational and career goals. The texts chosen for his Writing for Social Media class were both relevant and insightful, and the projects assigned ultimately helped to foster an understanding of electracy and digital environments.
